89 def __init__(self, data, kind=None, by=None, subplots=False, sharex=None, 

90 sharey=False, use_index=True, 

91 figsize=None, grid=None, legend=True, rot=None,

133 self.rot = rot 

134 # need to know for format_date_labels since it's rotated to 30 by 

135 # default 

136 self._rot_set = True 

137 else: 

138 self._rot_set = False 

139 self.rot = self._default_rot 

140 

141 if grid is None: 

142 grid = False if secondary_y else self.plt.rcParams['axes.grid'] 

143 

144 self.grid = grid 

145 self.legend = legend 

146 self.legend_handles = [] 

147 self.legend_labels = [] 

148 

149 for attr in self._pop_attributes: 

150 value = kwds.pop(attr, self._attr_defaults.get(attr, None)) 

151 setattr(self, attr, value)

153 self.ax = ax 

154 self.fig = fig 

155 self.axes = None

157 # parse errorbar input if given 

158 xerr = kwds.pop('xerr', None) 

159 yerr = kwds.pop('yerr', None) 

160 self.errors = {kw: self._parse_errorbars(kw, err) 

161 for kw, err in zip(['xerr', 'yerr'], [xerr, yerr])} 

162 

163 if not isinstance(secondary_y, (bool, tuple, list, 

164 np.ndarray, ABCIndexClass)): 

165 secondary_y = [secondary_y] 

166 self.secondary_y = secondary_y

171 raise TypeError("Only specify one of `cmap` and `colormap`.") 

172 elif 'cmap' in kwds: 

173 self.colormap = kwds.pop('cmap')

183 def _validate_color_args(self): 

184 if 'color' not in self.kwds and 'colors' in self.kwds: 

185 warnings.warn(("'colors' is being deprecated. Please use 'color'" 

186 "instead of 'colors'")) 

187 colors = self.kwds.pop('colors') 

188 self.kwds['color'] = colors 

189 

190 if ('color' in self.kwds and self.nseries == 1 and 

191 not is_list_like(self.kwds['color'])): 

192 # support series.plot(color='green') 

193 self.kwds['color'] = [self.kwds['color']] 

194 

195 if ('color' in self.kwds and isinstance(self.kwds['color'], tuple) and 

196 self.nseries == 1 and len(self.kwds['color']) in (3, 4)): 

197 # support RGB and RGBA tuples in series plot 

198 self.kwds['color'] = [self.kwds['color']] 

199 

200 if ('color' in self.kwds or 'colors' in self.kwds) and \ 

201 self.colormap is not None: 

202 warnings.warn("'color' and 'colormap' cannot be used " 

203 "simultaneously. Using 'color'") 

204 

205 if 'color' in self.kwds and self.style is not None: 

206 if is_list_like(self.style): 

207 styles = self.style 

208 else: 

209 styles = [self.style] 

210 # need only a single match 

211 for s in styles: 

212 if re.match('^[a-z]+?', s) is not None: 

213 raise ValueError( 

214 "Cannot pass 'style' string with a color " 

215 "symbol and 'color' keyword argument. Please" 

216 " use one or the other or pass 'style' " 

217 "without a color symbol")

219 def _iter_data(self, data=None, keep_index=False, fillna=None): 

220 if data is None: 

221 data = self.data 

222 if fillna is not None: 

223 data = data.fillna(fillna) 

224 

225 # TODO: unused? 

226 # if self.sort_columns: 

227 # columns = com.try_sort(data.columns) 

228 # else: 

229 # columns = data.columns 

230 

231 for col, values in data.iteritems(): 

232 if keep_index is True: 

233 yield col, values 

234 else: 

235 yield col, values.values

237 @property 

238 def nseries(self): 

239 if self.data.ndim == 1: 

240 return 1 

241 else: 

242 return self.data.shape[1]

245 self.plt.draw_if_interactive()

248 self._args_adjust()

256 for ax in self.axes: 

257 self._post_plot_logic_common(ax, self.data) 

258 self._post_plot_logic(ax, self.data)

263 def _has_plotted_object(self, ax): 

264 """check whether ax has data""" 

265 return (len(ax.lines) != 0 or 

266 len(ax.artists) != 0 or 

267 len(ax.containers) != 0)

269 def _maybe_right_yaxis(self, ax, axes_num): 

270 if not self.on_right(axes_num): 

271 # secondary axes may be passed via ax kw 

272 return self._get_ax_layer(ax) 

273 

274 if hasattr(ax, 'right_ax'): 

275 # if it has right_ax proparty, ``ax`` must be left axes 

276 return ax.right_ax 

277 elif hasattr(ax, 'left_ax'): 

278 # if it has left_ax proparty, ``ax`` must be right axes 

279 return ax 

280 else: 

281 # otherwise, create twin axes 

282 orig_ax, new_ax = ax, ax.twinx() 

283 # TODO: use Matplotlib public API when available 

284 new_ax._get_lines = orig_ax._get_lines 

285 new_ax._get_patches_for_fill = orig_ax._get_patches_for_fill 

286 orig_ax.right_ax, new_ax.left_ax = new_ax, orig_ax 

287 

288 if not self._has_plotted_object(orig_ax): # no data on left y 

289 orig_ax.get_yaxis().set_visible(False) 

290 

291 if self.logy or self.loglog: 

292 new_ax.set_yscale('log') 

293 return new_ax 

294 

295 def _setup_subplots(self): 

296 if self.subplots: 

297 fig, axes = _subplots(naxes=self.nseries, 

298 sharex=self.sharex, sharey=self.sharey, 

299 figsize=self.figsize, ax=self.ax, 

300 layout=self.layout, 

301 layout_type=self._layout_type) 

302 else: 

303 if self.ax is None: 

304 fig = self.plt.figure(figsize=self.figsize) 

305 axes = fig.add_subplot(111) 

306 else: 

307 fig = self.ax.get_figure() 

308 if self.figsize is not None: 

309 fig.set_size_inches(self.figsize) 

310 axes = self.ax 

311 

312 axes = _flatten(axes) 

313 

314 if self.logx or self.loglog: 

315 [a.set_xscale('log') for a in axes] 

316 if self.logy or self.loglog: 

317 [a.set_yscale('log') for a in axes] 

318 

319 self.fig = fig 

320 self.axes = axes 

321 

322 @property 

323 def result(self): 

324 """ 

325 Return result axes 

326 """ 

327 if self.subplots: 

328 if self.layout is not None and not is_list_like(self.ax): 

329 return self.axes.reshape(*self.layout) 

330 else: 

331 return self.axes 

332 else: 

333 sec_true = isinstance(self.secondary_y, bool) and self.secondary_y 

334 all_sec = (is_list_like(self.secondary_y) and 

335 len(self.secondary_y) == self.nseries) 

336 if (sec_true or all_sec): 

337 # if all data is plotted on secondary, return right axes 

338 return self._get_ax_layer(self.axes[0], primary=False) 

339 else: 

340 return self.axes[0]

342 def _compute_plot_data(self): 

343 data = self.data 

344 

345 if isinstance(data, ABCSeries): 

346 label = self.label 

347 if label is None and data.name is None: 

348 label = 'None' 

349 data = data.to_frame(name=label) 

350 

351 # GH16953, _convert is needed as fallback, for ``Series`` 

352 # with ``dtype == object`` 

353 data = data._convert(datetime=True, timedelta=True) 

354 numeric_data = data.select_dtypes(include=[np.number, 

355 "datetime", 

356 "datetimetz", 

357 "timedelta"]) 

358 

359 try: 

360 is_empty = numeric_data.empty 

361 except AttributeError: 

362 is_empty = not len(numeric_data) 

363 

364 # no empty frames or series allowed 

365 if is_empty: 

366 raise TypeError('Empty {0!r}: no numeric data to ' 

367 'plot'.format(numeric_data.__class__.__name__)) 

368 

369 self.data = numeric_data 

370 

371 def _make_plot(self): 

372 raise AbstractMethodError(self) 

373 

374 def _add_table(self): 

375 if self.table is False: 

376 return 

377 elif self.table is True: 

378 data = self.data.transpose() 

379 else: 

380 data = self.table 

381 ax = self._get_ax(0) 

382 table(ax, data) 

383 

384 def _post_plot_logic_common(self, ax, data): 

385 """Common post process for each axes""" 

386 

387 def get_label(i): 

388 try: 

389 return pprint_thing(data.index[i]) 

390 except Exception: 

391 return '' 

392 

393 if self.orientation == 'vertical' or self.orientation is None: 

394 if self._need_to_set_index: 

395 xticklabels = [get_label(x) for x in ax.get_xticks()] 

396 ax.set_xticklabels(xticklabels) 

397 self._apply_axis_properties(ax.xaxis, rot=self.rot, 

398 fontsize=self.fontsize) 

399 self._apply_axis_properties(ax.yaxis, fontsize=self.fontsize) 

400 

401 if hasattr(ax, 'right_ax'): 

402 self._apply_axis_properties(ax.right_ax.yaxis, 

403 fontsize=self.fontsize) 

404 

405 elif self.orientation == 'horizontal': 

406 if self._need_to_set_index: 

407 yticklabels = [get_label(y) for y in ax.get_yticks()] 

408 ax.set_yticklabels(yticklabels) 

409 self._apply_axis_properties(ax.yaxis, rot=self.rot, 

410 fontsize=self.fontsize) 

411 self._apply_axis_properties(ax.xaxis, fontsize=self.fontsize) 

412 

413 if hasattr(ax, 'right_ax'): 

414 self._apply_axis_properties(ax.right_ax.yaxis, 

415 fontsize=self.fontsize) 

416 else: # pragma no cover 

417 raise ValueError 

418 

419 def _post_plot_logic(self, ax, data): 

420 """Post process for each axes. Overridden in child classes""" 

421 pass 

422 

423 def _adorn_subplots(self): 

424 """Common post process unrelated to data""" 

425 if len(self.axes) > 0: 

426 all_axes = self._get_subplots() 

427 nrows, ncols = self._get_axes_layout() 

428 _handle_shared_axes(axarr=all_axes, nplots=len(all_axes), 

429 naxes=nrows * ncols, nrows=nrows, 

430 ncols=ncols, sharex=self.sharex, 

431 sharey=self.sharey) 

432 

433 for ax in self.axes: 

434 if self.yticks is not None: 

435 ax.set_yticks(self.yticks) 

436 

437 if self.xticks is not None: 

438 ax.set_xticks(self.xticks) 

439 

440 if self.ylim is not None: 

441 ax.set_ylim(self.ylim) 

442 

443 if self.xlim is not None: 

444 ax.set_xlim(self.xlim) 

445 

446 ax.grid(self.grid) 

447 

448 if self.title: 

449 if self.subplots: 

450 if is_list_like(self.title): 

451 if len(self.title) != self.nseries: 

452 msg = ('The length of `title` must equal the number ' 

453 'of columns if using `title` of type `list` ' 

454 'and `subplots=True`.\n' 

455 'length of title = {}\n' 

456 'number of columns = {}').format( 

457 len(self.title), self.nseries) 

458 raise ValueError(msg) 

459 

460 for (ax, title) in zip(self.axes, self.title): 

461 ax.set_title(title) 

462 else: 

463 self.fig.suptitle(self.title) 

464 else: 

465 if is_list_like(self.title): 

466 msg = ('Using `title` of type `list` is not supported ' 

467 'unless `subplots=True` is passed') 

468 raise ValueError(msg) 

469 self.axes[0].set_title(self.title) 

470 

471 def _apply_axis_properties(self, axis, rot=None, fontsize=None): 

472 labels = axis.get_majorticklabels() + axis.get_minorticklabels() 

473 for label in labels: 

474 if rot is not None: 

475 label.set_rotation(rot) 

476 if fontsize is not None: 

477 label.set_fontsize(fontsize)

479 @property 

480 def legend_title(self): 

481 if not isinstance(self.data.columns, ABCMultiIndex): 

482 name = self.data.columns.name 

483 if name is not None: 

484 name = pprint_thing(name) 

485 return name 

486 else: 

487 stringified = map(pprint_thing, 

488 self.data.columns.names) 

489 return ','.join(stringified) 

490 

491 def _add_legend_handle(self, handle, label, index=None): 

492 if label is not None: 

493 if self.mark_right and index is not None: 

494 if self.on_right(index): 

495 label = label + ' (right)' 

496 self.legend_handles.append(handle) 

497 self.legend_labels.append(label) 

498 

499 def _make_legend(self): 

500 ax, leg = self._get_ax_legend(self.axes[0]) 

501 

502 handles = [] 

503 labels = [] 

504 title = '' 

505 

506 if not self.subplots: 

507 if leg is not None: 

508 title = leg.get_title().get_text() 

509 handles = leg.legendHandles 

510 labels = [x.get_text() for x in leg.get_texts()] 

511 

512 if self.legend: 

513 if self.legend == 'reverse': 

514 self.legend_handles = reversed(self.legend_handles) 

515 self.legend_labels = reversed(self.legend_labels) 

516 

517 handles += self.legend_handles 

518 labels += self.legend_labels 

519 if self.legend_title is not None: 

520 title = self.legend_title 

521 

522 if len(handles) > 0: 

523 ax.legend(handles, labels, loc='best', title=title) 

524 

525 elif self.subplots and self.legend: 

526 for ax in self.axes: 

527 if ax.get_visible(): 

528 ax.legend(loc='best') 

529 

530 def _get_ax_legend(self, ax): 

531 leg = ax.get_legend() 

532 other_ax = (getattr(ax, 'left_ax', None) or 

533 getattr(ax, 'right_ax', None)) 

534 other_leg = None 

535 if other_ax is not None: 

536 other_leg = other_ax.get_legend() 

537 if leg is None and other_leg is not None: 

538 leg = other_leg 

539 ax = other_ax 

540 return ax, leg

542 @cache_readonly 

543 def plt(self): 

544 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 

545 return plt 

546 

547 _need_to_set_index = False 

548 

549 def _get_xticks(self, convert_period=False): 

550 index = self.data.index 

551 is_datetype = index.inferred_type in ('datetime', 'date', 

552 'datetime64', 'time') 

553 

554 if self.use_index: 

555 if convert_period and isinstance(index, ABCPeriodIndex): 

556 self.data = self.data.reindex(index=index.sort_values()) 

557 x = self.data.index.to_timestamp()._mpl_repr() 

558 elif index.is_numeric(): 

559 """ 

560 Matplotlib supports numeric values or datetime objects as 

561 xaxis values. Taking LBYL approach here, by the time 

562 matplotlib raises exception when using non numeric/datetime 

563 values for xaxis, several actions are already taken by plt. 

564 """ 

565 x = index._mpl_repr() 

566 elif is_datetype: 

567 self.data = self.data[notna(self.data.index)] 

568 self.data = self.data.sort_index() 

569 x = self.data.index._mpl_repr() 

570 else: 

571 self._need_to_set_index = True 

572 x = lrange(len(index)) 

573 else: 

574 x = lrange(len(index)) 

575 

576 return x 

577 

578 @classmethod 

579 def _plot(cls, ax, x, y, style=None, is_errorbar=False, **kwds): 

580 mask = isna(y) 

581 if mask.any(): 

582 y = np.ma.array(y) 

583 y = np.ma.masked_where(mask, y) 

584 

585 if isinstance(x, ABCIndexClass): 

586 x = x._mpl_repr() 

587 

588 if is_errorbar: 

589 if 'xerr' in kwds: 

590 kwds['xerr'] = np.array(kwds.get('xerr')) 

591 if 'yerr' in kwds: 

592 kwds['yerr'] = np.array(kwds.get('yerr')) 

593 return ax.errorbar(x, y, **kwds) 

594 else: 

595 # prevent style kwarg from going to errorbar, where it is 

596 # unsupported 

597 if style is not None: 

598 args = (x, y, style) 

599 else: 

600 args = (x, y) 

601 return ax.plot(*args, **kwds) 

602 

603 def _get_index_name(self): 

604 if isinstance(self.data.index, ABCMultiIndex): 

605 name = self.data.index.names 

606 if com._any_not_none(*name): 

607 name = ','.join(pprint_thing(x) for x in name) 

608 else: 

609 name = None 

610 else: 

611 name = self.data.index.name 

612 if name is not None: 

613 name = pprint_thing(name) 

614 

615 return name

617 @classmethod 

618 def _get_ax_layer(cls, ax, primary=True): 

619 """get left (primary) or right (secondary) axes""" 

620 if primary: 

621 return getattr(ax, 'left_ax', ax) 

622 else: 

623 return getattr(ax, 'right_ax', ax) 

624 

625 def _get_ax(self, i): 

626 # get the twinx ax if appropriate 

627 if self.subplots: 

628 ax = self.axes[i] 

629 ax = self._maybe_right_yaxis(ax, i) 

630 self.axes[i] = ax 

631 else: 

632 ax = self.axes[0] 

633 ax = self._maybe_right_yaxis(ax, i) 

634 

635 ax.get_yaxis().set_visible(True) 

636 return ax 

637 

638 def on_right(self, i): 

639 if isinstance(self.secondary_y, bool): 

640 return self.secondary_y 

641 

642 if isinstance(self.secondary_y, (tuple, list, 

643 np.ndarray, ABCIndexClass)): 

644 return self.data.columns[i] in self.secondary_y 

645 

646 def _apply_style_colors(self, colors, kwds, col_num, label): 

647 """ 

648 Manage style and color based on column number and its label. 

649 Returns tuple of appropriate style and kwds which "color" may be added. 

650 """ 

651 style = None 

652 if self.style is not None: 

653 if isinstance(self.style, list): 

654 try: 

655 style = self.style[col_num] 

656 except IndexError: 

657 pass 

658 elif isinstance(self.style, dict): 

659 style = self.style.get(label, style) 

660 else: 

661 style = self.style 

662 

663 has_color = 'color' in kwds or self.colormap is not None 

664 nocolor_style = style is None or re.match('[a-z]+', style) is None 

665 if (has_color or self.subplots) and nocolor_style: 

666 kwds['color'] = colors[col_num % len(colors)] 

667 return style, kwds 

668 

669 def _get_colors(self, num_colors=None, color_kwds='color'): 

670 if num_colors is None: 

671 num_colors = self.nseries 

672 

673 return _get_standard_colors(num_colors=num_colors, 

674 colormap=self.colormap, 

675 color=self.kwds.get(color_kwds)) 

676 

677 def _parse_errorbars(self, label, err): 

678 """ 

679 Look for error keyword arguments and return the actual errorbar data 

680 or return the error DataFrame/dict 

681 

682 Error bars can be specified in several ways: 

683 Series: the user provides a pandas.Series object of the same 

684 length as the data 

685 ndarray: provides a np.ndarray of the same length as the data 

686 DataFrame/dict: error values are paired with keys matching the 

687 key in the plotted DataFrame 

688 str: the name of the column within the plotted DataFrame 

689 """ 

690 

691 if err is None: 

692 return None 

693 

694 def match_labels(data, e): 

695 e = e.reindex(data.index) 

696 return e 

697 

698 # key-matched DataFrame 

699 if isinstance(err, ABCDataFrame): 

700 

701 err = match_labels(self.data, err) 

702 # key-matched dict 

703 elif isinstance(err, dict): 

704 pass 

705 

706 # Series of error values 

707 elif isinstance(err, ABCSeries): 

708 # broadcast error series across data 

709 err = match_labels(self.data, err) 

710 err = np.atleast_2d(err) 

711 err = np.tile(err, (self.nseries, 1)) 

712 

713 # errors are a column in the dataframe 

714 elif isinstance(err, string_types): 

715 evalues = self.data[err].values 

716 self.data = self.data[self.data.columns.drop(err)] 

717 err = np.atleast_2d(evalues) 

718 err = np.tile(err, (self.nseries, 1)) 

719 

720 elif is_list_like(err): 

721 if is_iterator(err): 

722 err = np.atleast_2d(list(err)) 

723 else: 

724 # raw error values 

725 err = np.atleast_2d(err) 

726 

727 err_shape = err.shape 

728 

729 # asymmetrical error bars 

730 if err.ndim == 3: 

731 if (err_shape[0] != self.nseries) or \ 

732 (err_shape[1] != 2) or \ 

733 (err_shape[2] != len(self.data)): 

734 msg = "Asymmetrical error bars should be provided " + \ 

735 "with the shape (%u, 2, %u)" % \ 

736 (self.nseries, len(self.data)) 

737 raise ValueError(msg) 

738 

739 # broadcast errors to each data series 

740 if len(err) == 1: 

741 err = np.tile(err, (self.nseries, 1)) 

742 

743 elif is_number(err): 

744 err = np.tile([err], (self.nseries, len(self.data))) 

745 

746 else: 

747 msg = "No valid {label} detected".format(label=label) 

748 raise ValueError(msg) 

749 

750 return err 

751 

752 def _get_errorbars(self, label=None, index=None, xerr=True, yerr=True): 

753 errors = {} 

754 

755 for kw, flag in zip(['xerr', 'yerr'], [xerr, yerr]): 

756 if flag: 

757 err = self.errors[kw] 

758 # user provided label-matched dataframe of errors 

759 if isinstance(err, (ABCDataFrame, dict)): 

760 if label is not None and label in err.keys(): 

761 err = err[label] 

762 else: 

763 err = None 

764 elif index is not None and err is not None: 

765 err = err[index] 

766 

767 if err is not None: 

768 errors[kw] = err 

769 return errors 

770 

771 def _get_subplots(self): 

772 from matplotlib.axes import Subplot 

773 return [ax for ax in self.axes[0].get_figure().get_axes() 

774 if isinstance(ax, Subplot)] 

775 

776 def _get_axes_layout(self): 

777 axes = self._get_subplots() 

778 x_set = set() 

779 y_set = set() 

780 for ax in axes: 

781 # check axes coordinates to estimate layout 

782 points = ax.get_position().get_points() 

783 x_set.add(points[0][0]) 

784 y_set.add(points[0][1]) 

785 return (len(y_set), len(x_set)) 

786 

787 

788class PlanePlot(MPLPlot): 

789 """ 

790 Abstract class for plotting on plane, currently scatter and hexbin. 

791 """ 

792 

793 _layout_type = 'single' 

794 

795 def __init__(self, data, x, y, **kwargs): 

796 MPLPlot.__init__(self, data, **kwargs) 

797 if x is None or y is None: 

798 raise ValueError(self._kind + ' requires an x and y column') 

799 if is_integer(x) and not self.data.columns.holds_integer(): 

800 x = self.data.columns[x] 

801 if is_integer(y) and not self.data.columns.holds_integer(): 

802 y = self.data.columns[y] 

803 if len(self.data[x]._get_numeric_data()) == 0: 

804 raise ValueError(self._kind + ' requires x column to be numeric') 

805 if len(self.data[y]._get_numeric_data()) == 0: 

806 raise ValueError(self._kind + ' requires y column to be numeric') 

807 

808 self.x = x 

809 self.y = y 

810 

811 @property 

812 def nseries(self): 

813 return 1 

814 

815 def _post_plot_logic(self, ax, data): 

816 x, y = self.x, self.y 

817 ax.set_ylabel(pprint_thing(y)) 

818 ax.set_xlabel(pprint_thing(x)) 

819 

820 def _plot_colorbar(self, ax, **kwds): 

821 # Addresses issues #10611 and #10678: 

822 # When plotting scatterplots and hexbinplots in IPython 

823 # inline backend the colorbar axis height tends not to 

824 # exactly match the parent axis height. 

825 # The difference is due to small fractional differences 

826 # in floating points with similar representation. 

827 # To deal with this, this method forces the colorbar 

828 # height to take the height of the parent axes. 

829 # For a more detailed description of the issue 

830 # see the following link: 

831 # https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/11215 

832 img = ax.collections[0] 

833 cbar = self.fig.colorbar(img, ax=ax, **kwds) 

834 

835 if _mpl_ge_3_0_0(): 

836 # The workaround below is no longer necessary. 

837 return 

838 

839 points = ax.get_position().get_points() 

840 cbar_points = cbar.ax.get_position().get_points() 

841 

842 cbar.ax.set_position([cbar_points[0, 0], 

843 points[0, 1], 

844 cbar_points[1, 0] - cbar_points[0, 0], 

845 points[1, 1] - points[0, 1]]) 

846 # To see the discrepancy in axis heights uncomment 

847 # the following two lines: 

848 # print(points[1, 1] - points[0, 1]) 

849 # print(cbar_points[1, 1] - cbar_points[0, 1]) 

850 

851 

852class ScatterPlot(PlanePlot): 

853 _kind = 'scatter' 

854 

855 def __init__(self, data, x, y, s=None, c=None, **kwargs): 

856 if s is None: 

857 # hide the matplotlib default for size, in case we want to change 

858 # the handling of this argument later 

859 s = 20 

860 super(ScatterPlot, self).__init__(data, x, y, s=s, **kwargs) 

861 if is_integer(c) and not self.data.columns.holds_integer(): 

862 c = self.data.columns[c] 

863 self.c = c 

864 

865 def _make_plot(self): 

866 x, y, c, data = self.x, self.y, self.c, self.data 

867 ax = self.axes[0] 

868 

869 c_is_column = is_hashable(c) and c in self.data.columns 

870 

871 # plot a colorbar only if a colormap is provided or necessary 

872 cb = self.kwds.pop('colorbar', self.colormap or c_is_column) 

873 

874 # pandas uses colormap, matplotlib uses cmap. 

875 cmap = self.colormap or 'Greys' 

876 cmap = self.plt.cm.get_cmap(cmap) 

877 color = self.kwds.pop("color", None) 

878 if c is not None and color is not None: 

879 raise TypeError('Specify exactly one of `c` and `color`') 

880 elif c is None and color is None: 

881 c_values = self.plt.rcParams['patch.facecolor'] 

882 elif color is not None: 

883 c_values = color 

884 elif c_is_column: 

885 c_values = self.data[c].values 

886 else: 

887 c_values = c 

888 

889 if self.legend and hasattr(self, 'label'): 

890 label = self.label 

891 else: 

892 label = None 

893 scatter = ax.scatter(data[x].values, data[y].values, c=c_values, 

894 label=label, cmap=cmap, **self.kwds) 

895 if cb: 

896 cbar_label = c if c_is_column else '' 

897 self._plot_colorbar(ax, label=cbar_label) 

898 

899 if label is not None: 

900 self._add_legend_handle(scatter, label) 

901 else: 

902 self.legend = False 

903 

904 errors_x = self._get_errorbars(label=x, index=0, yerr=False) 

905 errors_y = self._get_errorbars(label=y, index=0, xerr=False) 

906 if len(errors_x) > 0 or len(errors_y) > 0: 

907 err_kwds = dict(errors_x, **errors_y) 

908 err_kwds['ecolor'] = scatter.get_facecolor()[0] 

909 ax.errorbar(data[x].values, data[y].values, 

910 linestyle='none', **err_kwds)

913class HexBinPlot(PlanePlot): 

914 _kind = 'hexbin' 

915 

916 def __init__(self, data, x, y, C=None, **kwargs): 

917 super(HexBinPlot, self).__init__(data, x, y, **kwargs) 

918 if is_integer(C) and not self.data.columns.holds_integer(): 

919 C = self.data.columns[C] 

920 self.C = C 

921 

922 def _make_plot(self): 

923 x, y, data, C = self.x, self.y, self.data, self.C 

924 ax = self.axes[0] 

925 # pandas uses colormap, matplotlib uses cmap. 

926 cmap = self.colormap or 'BuGn' 

927 cmap = self.plt.cm.get_cmap(cmap) 

928 cb = self.kwds.pop('colorbar', True) 

929 

930 if C is None: 

931 c_values = None 

932 else:

934 

935 ax.hexbin(data[x].values, data[y].values, C=c_values, cmap=cmap, 

936 **self.kwds) 

937 if cb: 

938 self._plot_colorbar(ax)

941 pass

943 

944class LinePlot(MPLPlot): 

945 _kind = 'line' 

946 _default_rot = 0 

947 orientation = 'vertical' 

948 

949 def __init__(self, data, **kwargs): 

950 MPLPlot.__init__(self, data, **kwargs) 

951 if self.stacked: 

952 self.data = self.data.fillna(value=0) 

953 self.x_compat = plot_params['x_compat'] 

954 if 'x_compat' in self.kwds: 

955 self.x_compat = bool(self.kwds.pop('x_compat')) 

956 

957 def _is_ts_plot(self): 

958 # this is slightly deceptive 

959 return not self.x_compat and self.use_index and self._use_dynamic_x() 

960 

961 def _use_dynamic_x(self): 

962 from pandas.plotting._timeseries import _use_dynamic_x 

963 return _use_dynamic_x(self._get_ax(0), self.data) 

964 

965 def _make_plot(self): 

966 if self._is_ts_plot(): 

967 from pandas.plotting._timeseries import _maybe_convert_index 

968 data = _maybe_convert_index(self._get_ax(0), self.data) 

969 

970 x = data.index # dummy, not used 

971 plotf = self._ts_plot 

972 it = self._iter_data(data=data, keep_index=True) 

973 else: 

974 x = self._get_xticks(convert_period=True) 

975 plotf = self._plot 

976 it = self._iter_data() 

977 

978 stacking_id = self._get_stacking_id() 

979 is_errorbar = com._any_not_none(*self.errors.values()) 

980 

981 colors = self._get_colors() 

982 for i, (label, y) in enumerate(it): 

983 ax = self._get_ax(i) 

984 kwds = self.kwds.copy() 

985 style, kwds = self._apply_style_colors(colors, kwds, i, label) 

986 

987 errors = self._get_errorbars(label=label, index=i) 

988 kwds = dict(kwds, **errors) 

989 

990 label = pprint_thing(label) # .encode('utf-8') 

991 kwds['label'] = label 

992 

993 newlines = plotf(ax, x, y, style=style, column_num=i, 

994 stacking_id=stacking_id, 

995 is_errorbar=is_errorbar, 

996 **kwds) 

997 self._add_legend_handle(newlines[0], label, index=i) 

998 

999 lines = _get_all_lines(ax) 

1000 left, right = _get_xlim(lines) 

1001 ax.set_xlim(left, right) 

1002 

1003 @classmethod 

1004 def _plot(cls, ax, x, y, style=None, column_num=None, 

1005 stacking_id=None, **kwds): 

1006 # column_num is used to get the target column from protf in line and 

1007 # area plots 

1008 if column_num == 0: 

1009 cls._initialize_stacker(ax, stacking_id, len(y)) 

1010 y_values = cls._get_stacked_values(ax, stacking_id, y, kwds['label']) 

1011 lines = MPLPlot._plot(ax, x, y_values, style=style, **kwds) 

1012 cls._update_stacker(ax, stacking_id, y) 

1013 return lines 

1014 

1015 @classmethod 

1016 def _ts_plot(cls, ax, x, data, style=None, **kwds): 

1017 from pandas.plotting._timeseries import (_maybe_resample, 

1018 _decorate_axes, 

1019 format_dateaxis) 

1020 # accept x to be consistent with normal plot func, 

1021 # x is not passed to tsplot as it uses data.index as x coordinate 

1022 # column_num must be in kwds for stacking purpose 

1023 freq, data = _maybe_resample(data, ax, kwds) 

1024 

1025 # Set ax with freq info 

1026 _decorate_axes(ax, freq, kwds) 

1027 # digging deeper 

1028 if hasattr(ax, 'left_ax'): 

1029 _decorate_axes(ax.left_ax, freq, kwds) 

1030 if hasattr(ax, 'right_ax'): 

1031 _decorate_axes(ax.right_ax, freq, kwds) 

1032 ax._plot_data.append((data, cls._kind, kwds)) 

1033 

1034 lines = cls._plot(ax, data.index, data.values, style=style, **kwds) 

1035 # set date formatter, locators and rescale limits 

1036 format_dateaxis(ax, ax.freq, data.index) 

1037 return lines 

1038 

1039 def _get_stacking_id(self): 

1040 if self.stacked: 

1041 return id(self.data) 

1042 else: 

1043 return None 

1044 

1045 @classmethod 

1046 def _initialize_stacker(cls, ax, stacking_id, n): 

1047 if stacking_id is None: 

1048 return 

1049 if not hasattr(ax, '_stacker_pos_prior'): 

1050 ax._stacker_pos_prior = {} 

1051 if not hasattr(ax, '_stacker_neg_prior'): 

1052 ax._stacker_neg_prior = {} 

1053 ax._stacker_pos_prior[stacking_id] = np.zeros(n) 

1054 ax._stacker_neg_prior[stacking_id] = np.zeros(n) 

1055 

1056 @classmethod 

1057 def _get_stacked_values(cls, ax, stacking_id, values, label): 

1058 if stacking_id is None: 

1059 return values 

1060 if not hasattr(ax, '_stacker_pos_prior'): 

1061 # stacker may not be initialized for subplots 

1062 cls._initialize_stacker(ax, stacking_id, len(values)) 

1063 

1064 if (values >= 0).all(): 

1065 return ax._stacker_pos_prior[stacking_id] + values 

1066 elif (values <= 0).all(): 

1067 return ax._stacker_neg_prior[stacking_id] + values 

1068 

1069 raise ValueError('When stacked is True, each column must be either ' 

1070 'all positive or negative.' 

1071 '{0} contains both positive and negative values' 

1072 .format(label)) 

1073 

1074 @classmethod 

1075 def _update_stacker(cls, ax, stacking_id, values): 

1076 if stacking_id is None: 

1077 return 

1078 if (values >= 0).all(): 

1079 ax._stacker_pos_prior[stacking_id] += values 

1080 elif (values <= 0).all(): 

1081 ax._stacker_neg_prior[stacking_id] += values 

1082 

1083 def _post_plot_logic(self, ax, data): 

1084 condition = (not self._use_dynamic_x() and 

1085 data.index.is_all_dates and 

1086 not self.subplots or 

1087 (self.subplots and self.sharex)) 

1088 

1089 index_name = self._get_index_name() 

1090 

1091 if condition: 

1092 # irregular TS rotated 30 deg. by default 

1093 # probably a better place to check / set this. 

1094 if not self._rot_set: 

1095 self.rot = 30 

1096 format_date_labels(ax, rot=self.rot) 

1097 

1098 if index_name is not None and self.use_index: 

1099 ax.set_xlabel(index_name)

1101 

1102class AreaPlot(LinePlot): 

1103 _kind = 'area' 

1104 

1105 def __init__(self, data, **kwargs): 

1106 kwargs.setdefault('stacked', True) 

1107 data = data.fillna(value=0) 

1108 LinePlot.__init__(self, data, **kwargs) 

1109 

1110 if not self.stacked: 

1111 # use smaller alpha to distinguish overlap 

1112 self.kwds.setdefault('alpha', 0.5) 

1113 

1114 if self.logy or self.loglog: 

1115 raise ValueError("Log-y scales are not supported in area plot") 

1116 

1117 @classmethod 

1118 def _plot(cls, ax, x, y, style=None, column_num=None, 

1119 stacking_id=None, is_errorbar=False, **kwds): 

1120 

1121 if column_num == 0: 

1122 cls._initialize_stacker(ax, stacking_id, len(y)) 

1123 y_values = cls._get_stacked_values(ax, stacking_id, y, kwds['label']) 

1124 

1125 # need to remove label, because subplots uses mpl legend as it is 

1126 line_kwds = kwds.copy() 

1127 line_kwds.pop('label') 

1128 lines = MPLPlot._plot(ax, x, y_values, style=style, **line_kwds) 

1129 

1130 # get data from the line to get coordinates for fill_between 

1131 xdata, y_values = lines[0].get_data(orig=False) 

1132 

1133 # unable to use ``_get_stacked_values`` here to get starting point 

1134 if stacking_id is None: 

1135 start = np.zeros(len(y)) 

1136 elif (y >= 0).all(): 

1137 start = ax._stacker_pos_prior[stacking_id] 

1138 elif (y <= 0).all(): 

1139 start = ax._stacker_neg_prior[stacking_id] 

1140 else: 

1141 start = np.zeros(len(y)) 

1142 

1143 if 'color' not in kwds: 

1144 kwds['color'] = lines[0].get_color() 

1145 

1146 rect = ax.fill_between(xdata, start, y_values, **kwds) 

1147 cls._update_stacker(ax, stacking_id, y) 

1148 

1149 # LinePlot expects list of artists 

1150 res = [rect] 

1151 return res 

1152 

1153 def _post_plot_logic(self, ax, data): 

1154 LinePlot._post_plot_logic(self, ax, data) 

1155 

1156 if self.ylim is None: 

1157 if (data >= 0).all().all(): 

1158 ax.set_ylim(0, None) 

1159 elif (data <= 0).all().all(): 

1160 ax.set_ylim(None, 0)

1162 

1163class BarPlot(MPLPlot): 

1164 _kind = 'bar' 

1165 _default_rot = 90 

1166 orientation = 'vertical' 

1167 

1168 def __init__(self, data, **kwargs): 

1169 # we have to treat a series differently than a 

1170 # 1-column DataFrame w.r.t. color handling 

1171 self._is_series = isinstance(data, ABCSeries) 

1172 self.bar_width = kwargs.pop('width', 0.5) 

1173 pos = kwargs.pop('position', 0.5) 

1174 kwargs.setdefault('align', 'center') 

1175 self.tick_pos = np.arange(len(data)) 

1176 

1177 self.bottom = kwargs.pop('bottom', 0) 

1178 self.left = kwargs.pop('left', 0) 

1179 

1180 self.log = kwargs.pop('log', False) 

1181 MPLPlot.__init__(self, data, **kwargs) 

1182 

1183 if self.stacked or self.subplots: 

1184 self.tickoffset = self.bar_width * pos 

1185 if kwargs['align'] == 'edge': 

1186 self.lim_offset = self.bar_width / 2 

1187 else: 

1188 self.lim_offset = 0 

1189 else: 

1190 if kwargs['align'] == 'edge': 

1191 w = self.bar_width / self.nseries 

1192 self.tickoffset = self.bar_width * (pos - 0.5) + w * 0.5 

1193 self.lim_offset = w * 0.5 

1194 else: 

1195 self.tickoffset = self.bar_width * pos 

1196 self.lim_offset = 0 

1197 

1198 self.ax_pos = self.tick_pos - self.tickoffset 

1199 

1200 def _args_adjust(self): 

1201 if is_list_like(self.bottom): 

1202 self.bottom = np.array(self.bottom) 

1203 if is_list_like(self.left): 

1204 self.left = np.array(self.left) 

1205 

1206 @classmethod 

1207 def _plot(cls, ax, x, y, w, start=0, log=False, **kwds): 

1208 return ax.bar(x, y, w, bottom=start, log=log, **kwds) 

1209 

1210 @property 

1211 def _start_base(self): 

1212 return self.bottom 

1213 

1214 def _make_plot(self): 

1215 import matplotlib as mpl 

1216 

1217 colors = self._get_colors() 

1218 ncolors = len(colors) 

1219 

1220 pos_prior = neg_prior = np.zeros(len(self.data)) 

1221 K = self.nseries 

1222 

1223 for i, (label, y) in enumerate(self._iter_data(fillna=0)): 

1224 ax = self._get_ax(i) 

1225 kwds = self.kwds.copy() 

1226 if self._is_series: 

1227 kwds['color'] = colors 

1228 else: 

1229 kwds['color'] = colors[i % ncolors] 

1230 

1231 errors = self._get_errorbars(label=label, index=i) 

1232 kwds = dict(kwds, **errors) 

1233 

1234 label = pprint_thing(label) 

1235 

1236 if (('yerr' in kwds) or ('xerr' in kwds)) \ 

1237 and (kwds.get('ecolor') is None): 

1238 kwds['ecolor'] = mpl.rcParams['xtick.color'] 

1239 

1240 start = 0 

1241 if self.log and (y >= 1).all(): 

1242 start = 1 

1243 start = start + self._start_base 

1244 

1245 if self.subplots: 

1246 w = self.bar_width / 2 

1247 rect = self._plot(ax, self.ax_pos + w, y, self.bar_width, 

1248 start=start, label=label, 

1249 log=self.log, **kwds) 

1250 ax.set_title(label) 

1251 elif self.stacked: 

1252 mask = y > 0 

1253 start = np.where(mask, pos_prior, neg_prior) + self._start_base 

1254 w = self.bar_width / 2 

1255 rect = self._plot(ax, self.ax_pos + w, y, self.bar_width, 

1256 start=start, label=label, 

1257 log=self.log, **kwds) 

1258 pos_prior = pos_prior + np.where(mask, y, 0) 

1259 neg_prior = neg_prior + np.where(mask, 0, y) 

1260 else: 

1261 w = self.bar_width / K 

1262 rect = self._plot(ax, self.ax_pos + (i + 0.5) * w, y, w, 

1263 start=start, label=label, 

1264 log=self.log, **kwds) 

1265 self._add_legend_handle(rect, label, index=i) 

1266 

1267 def _post_plot_logic(self, ax, data): 

1268 if self.use_index: 

1269 str_index = [pprint_thing(key) for key in data.index] 

1270 else: 

1271 str_index = [pprint_thing(key) for key in range(data.shape[0])] 

1272 name = self._get_index_name() 

1273 

1274 s_edge = self.ax_pos[0] - 0.25 + self.lim_offset 

1275 e_edge = self.ax_pos[-1] + 0.25 + self.bar_width + self.lim_offset 

1276 

1277 self._decorate_ticks(ax, name, str_index, s_edge, e_edge) 

1278 

1279 def _decorate_ticks(self, ax, name, ticklabels, start_edge, end_edge): 

1280 ax.set_xlim((start_edge, end_edge)) 

1281 ax.set_xticks(self.tick_pos) 

1282 ax.set_xticklabels(ticklabels) 

1283 if name is not None and self.use_index: 

1284 ax.set_xlabel(name)

1287class BarhPlot(BarPlot):

1294 return self.left

1298 return ax.barh(x, y, w, left=start, log=log, **kwds) 

1299 

1300 def _decorate_ticks(self, ax, name, ticklabels, start_edge, end_edge): 

1301 # horizontal bars 

1302 ax.set_ylim((start_edge, end_edge)) 

1303 ax.set_yticks(self.tick_pos) 

1304 ax.set_yticklabels(ticklabels)

1309class HistPlot(LinePlot): 

1310 _kind = 'hist' 

1311 

1312 def __init__(self, data, bins=10, bottom=0, **kwargs): 

1313 self.bins = bins # use mpl default 

1314 self.bottom = bottom 

1315 # Do not call LinePlot.__init__ which may fill nan 

1316 MPLPlot.__init__(self, data, **kwargs) 

1317 

1318 def _args_adjust(self): 

1319 if is_integer(self.bins): 

1320 # create common bin edge 

1321 values = (self.data._convert(datetime=True)._get_numeric_data()) 

1322 values = np.ravel(values) 

1323 values = values[~isna(values)] 

1324 

1325 hist, self.bins = np.histogram( 

1326 values, bins=self.bins, 

1327 range=self.kwds.get('range', None), 

1328 weights=self.kwds.get('weights', None)) 

1329 

1330 if is_list_like(self.bottom): 

1331 self.bottom = np.array(self.bottom) 

1332 

1333 @classmethod 

1334 def _plot(cls, ax, y, style=None, bins=None, bottom=0, column_num=0, 

1335 stacking_id=None, **kwds): 

1336 if column_num == 0: 

1337 cls._initialize_stacker(ax, stacking_id, len(bins) - 1) 

1338 y = y[~isna(y)] 

1339 

1340 base = np.zeros(len(bins) - 1) 

1341 bottom = bottom + \ 

1342 cls._get_stacked_values(ax, stacking_id, base, kwds['label']) 

1343 # ignore style 

1344 n, bins, patches = ax.hist(y, bins=bins, bottom=bottom, **kwds) 

1345 cls._update_stacker(ax, stacking_id, n) 

1346 return patches 

1347 

1348 def _make_plot(self): 

1349 colors = self._get_colors() 

1350 stacking_id = self._get_stacking_id() 

1351 

1352 for i, (label, y) in enumerate(self._iter_data()): 

1353 ax = self._get_ax(i) 

1354 

1355 kwds = self.kwds.copy() 

1356 

1357 label = pprint_thing(label) 

1358 kwds['label'] = label 

1359 

1360 style, kwds = self._apply_style_colors(colors, kwds, i, label) 

1361 if style is not None: 

1362 kwds['style'] = style 

1363 

1364 kwds = self._make_plot_keywords(kwds, y) 

1365 artists = self._plot(ax, y, column_num=i, 

1366 stacking_id=stacking_id, **kwds) 

1367 self._add_legend_handle(artists[0], label, index=i) 

1368 

1369 def _make_plot_keywords(self, kwds, y): 

1370 """merge BoxPlot/KdePlot properties to passed kwds""" 

1371 # y is required for KdePlot 

1372 kwds['bottom'] = self.bottom 

1373 kwds['bins'] = self.bins 

1374 return kwds 

1375 

1376 def _post_plot_logic(self, ax, data): 

1377 if self.orientation == 'horizontal': 

1378 ax.set_xlabel('Frequency') 

1379 else: 

1380 ax.set_ylabel('Frequency') 

1381 

1382 @property 

1383 def orientation(self): 

1384 if self.kwds.get('orientation', None) == 'horizontal': 

1385 return 'horizontal' 

1386 else: 

1387 return 'vertical'

1390_kde_docstring = """ 

1391 Generate Kernel Density Estimate plot using Gaussian kernels. 

1392 

1393 In statistics, `kernel density estimation`_ (KDE) is a non-parametric 

1394 way to estimate the probability density function (PDF) of a random 

1395 variable. This function uses Gaussian kernels and includes automatic 

1396 bandwidth determination. 

1397 

1398 .. _kernel density estimation: 

1399 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kernel_density_estimation 

1400 

1401 Parameters 

1402 ---------- 

1403 bw_method : str, scalar or callable, optional 

1404 The method used to calculate the estimator bandwidth. This can be 

1405 'scott', 'silverman', a scalar constant or a callable. 

1406 If None (default), 'scott' is used. 

1407 See :class:`scipy.stats.gaussian_kde` for more information. 

1408 ind : NumPy array or integer, optional 

1409 Evaluation points for the estimated PDF. If None (default), 

1410 1000 equally spaced points are used. If `ind` is a NumPy array, the 

1411 KDE is evaluated at the points passed. If `ind` is an integer, 

1412 `ind` number of equally spaced points are used. 

1413 **kwds : optional 

1414 Additional keyword arguments are documented in 

1415 :meth:`pandas.%(this-datatype)s.plot`. 

1416 

1417 Returns 

1418 ------- 

1419 axes : matplotlib.axes.Axes or numpy.ndarray of them 

1420 

1421 See Also 

1422 -------- 

1423 scipy.stats.gaussian_kde : Representation of a kernel-density 

1424 estimate using Gaussian kernels. This is the function used 

1425 internally to estimate the PDF. 

1426 %(sibling-datatype)s.plot.kde : Generate a KDE plot for a 

1427 %(sibling-datatype)s. 

1428 

1429 Examples 

1430 -------- 

1431 %(examples)s 

1432 """ 

1433 

1434 

1435class KdePlot(HistPlot): 

1436 _kind = 'kde' 

1437 orientation = 'vertical' 

1438 

1439 def __init__(self, data, bw_method=None, ind=None, **kwargs): 

1440 MPLPlot.__init__(self, data, **kwargs) 

1441 self.bw_method = bw_method 

1442 self.ind = ind 

1443 

1444 def _args_adjust(self): 

1445 pass 

1446 

1447 def _get_ind(self, y): 

1448 if self.ind is None: 

1449 # np.nanmax() and np.nanmin() ignores the missing values 

1450 sample_range = np.nanmax(y) - np.nanmin(y) 

1451 ind = np.linspace(np.nanmin(y) - 0.5 * sample_range, 

1452 np.nanmax(y) + 0.5 * sample_range, 1000) 

1453 elif is_integer(self.ind): 

1454 sample_range = np.nanmax(y) - np.nanmin(y) 

1455 ind = np.linspace(np.nanmin(y) - 0.5 * sample_range, 

1456 np.nanmax(y) + 0.5 * sample_range, self.ind) 

1457 else: 

1458 ind = self.ind 

1459 return ind 

1460 

1461 @classmethod 

1462 def _plot(cls, ax, y, style=None, bw_method=None, ind=None, 

1463 column_num=None, stacking_id=None, **kwds): 

1464 from scipy.stats import gaussian_kde 

1465 from scipy import __version__ as spv 

1466 

1467 y = remove_na_arraylike(y) 

1468 

1469 if LooseVersion(spv) >= '0.11.0': 

1470 gkde = gaussian_kde(y, bw_method=bw_method) 

1471 else: 

1472 gkde = gaussian_kde(y) 

1473 if bw_method is not None: 

1474 msg = ('bw_method was added in Scipy 0.11.0.' + 

1475 ' Scipy version in use is {spv}.'.format(spv=spv)) 

1476 warnings.warn(msg) 

1477 

1478 y = gkde.evaluate(ind) 

1479 lines = MPLPlot._plot(ax, ind, y, style=style, **kwds) 

1480 return lines 

1481 

1482 def _make_plot_keywords(self, kwds, y): 

1483 kwds['bw_method'] = self.bw_method 

1484 kwds['ind'] = self._get_ind(y) 

1485 return kwds 

1486 

1487 def _post_plot_logic(self, ax, data): 

1488 ax.set_ylabel('Density') 

1489

1491class PiePlot(MPLPlot): 

1492 _kind = 'pie' 

1493 _layout_type = 'horizontal' 

1494 

1495 def __init__(self, data, kind=None, **kwargs): 

1496 data = data.fillna(value=0) 

1497 if (data < 0).any().any(): 

1498 raise ValueError("{0} doesn't allow negative values".format(kind)) 

1499 MPLPlot.__init__(self, data, kind=kind, **kwargs) 

1500 

1501 def _args_adjust(self): 

1502 self.grid = False 

1503 self.logy = False 

1504 self.logx = False 

1505 self.loglog = False 

1506 

1507 def _validate_color_args(self): 

1508 pass 

1509 

1510 def _make_plot(self): 

1511 colors = self._get_colors( 

1512 num_colors=len(self.data), color_kwds='colors') 

1513 self.kwds.setdefault('colors', colors) 

1514 

1515 for i, (label, y) in enumerate(self._iter_data()): 

1516 ax = self._get_ax(i) 

1517 if label is not None: 

1518 label = pprint_thing(label) 

1519 ax.set_ylabel(label) 

1520 

1521 kwds = self.kwds.copy() 

1522 

1523 def blank_labeler(label, value): 

1524 if value == 0: 

1525 return '' 

1526 else: 

1527 return label 

1528 

1529 idx = [pprint_thing(v) for v in self.data.index] 

1530 labels = kwds.pop('labels', idx) 

1531 # labels is used for each wedge's labels 

1532 # Blank out labels for values of 0 so they don't overlap 

1533 # with nonzero wedges 

1534 if labels is not None: 

1535 blabels = [blank_labeler(l, value) for 

1536 l, value in zip(labels, y)] 

1537 else: 

1538 blabels = None 

1539 results = ax.pie(y, labels=blabels, **kwds) 

1540 

1541 if kwds.get('autopct', None) is not None: 

1542 patches, texts, autotexts = results 

1543 else: 

1544 patches, texts = results 

1545 autotexts = [] 

1546 

1547 if self.fontsize is not None: 

1548 for t in texts + autotexts: 

1549 t.set_fontsize(self.fontsize) 

1550 

1551 # leglabels is used for legend labels 

1552 leglabels = labels if labels is not None else idx 

1553 for p, l in zip(patches, leglabels): 

1554 self._add_legend_handle(p, l)

1557class BoxPlot(LinePlot): 

1558 _kind = 'box' 

1559 _layout_type = 'horizontal' 

1560 

1561 _valid_return_types = (None, 'axes', 'dict', 'both') 

1562 # namedtuple to hold results 

1563 BP = namedtuple("Boxplot", ['ax', 'lines']) 

1564 

1565 def __init__(self, data, return_type='axes', **kwargs): 

1566 # Do not call LinePlot.__init__ which may fill nan 

1567 if return_type not in self._valid_return_types: 

1568 raise ValueError( 

1569 "return_type must be {None, 'axes', 'dict', 'both'}") 

1570 

1571 self.return_type = return_type 

1572 MPLPlot.__init__(self, data, **kwargs) 

1573 

1574 def _args_adjust(self): 

1575 if self.subplots: 

1576 # Disable label ax sharing. Otherwise, all subplots shows last 

1577 # column label 

1578 if self.orientation == 'vertical': 

1579 self.sharex = False 

1580 else: 

1581 self.sharey = False 

1582 

1583 @classmethod 

1584 def _plot(cls, ax, y, column_num=None, return_type='axes', **kwds): 

1585 if y.ndim == 2: 

1586 y = [remove_na_arraylike(v) for v in y] 

1587 # Boxplot fails with empty arrays, so need to add a NaN 

1588 # if any cols are empty 

1589 # GH 8181 

1590 y = [v if v.size > 0 else np.array([np.nan]) for v in y] 

1591 else: 

1592 y = remove_na_arraylike(y) 

1593 bp = ax.boxplot(y, **kwds) 

1594 

1595 if return_type == 'dict': 

1596 return bp, bp 

1597 elif return_type == 'both': 

1598 return cls.BP(ax=ax, lines=bp), bp 

1599 else: 

1600 return ax, bp 

1601 

1602 def _validate_color_args(self): 

1603 if 'color' in self.kwds: 

1604 if self.colormap is not None: 

1605 warnings.warn("'color' and 'colormap' cannot be used " 

1606 "simultaneously. Using 'color'") 

1607 self.color = self.kwds.pop('color') 

1608 

1609 if isinstance(self.color, dict): 

1610 valid_keys = ['boxes', 'whiskers', 'medians', 'caps'] 

1611 for key, values in compat.iteritems(self.color): 

1612 if key not in valid_keys: 

1613 raise ValueError("color dict contains invalid " 

1614 "key '{0}' " 

1615 "The key must be either {1}" 

1616 .format(key, valid_keys)) 

1617 else: 

1618 self.color = None 

1619 

1620 # get standard colors for default 

1621 colors = _get_standard_colors(num_colors=3, 

1622 colormap=self.colormap, 

1623 color=None) 

1624 # use 2 colors by default, for box/whisker and median 

1625 # flier colors isn't needed here 

1626 # because it can be specified by ``sym`` kw 

1627 self._boxes_c = colors[0] 

1628 self._whiskers_c = colors[0] 

1629 self._medians_c = colors[2] 

1630 self._caps_c = 'k' # mpl default 

1631 

1632 def _get_colors(self, num_colors=None, color_kwds='color'): 

1633 pass 

1634 

1635 def maybe_color_bp(self, bp): 

1636 if isinstance(self.color, dict): 

1637 boxes = self.color.get('boxes', self._boxes_c) 

1638 whiskers = self.color.get('whiskers', self._whiskers_c) 

1639 medians = self.color.get('medians', self._medians_c) 

1640 caps = self.color.get('caps', self._caps_c) 

1641 else: 

1642 # Other types are forwarded to matplotlib 

1643 # If None, use default colors 

1644 boxes = self.color or self._boxes_c 

1645 whiskers = self.color or self._whiskers_c 

1646 medians = self.color or self._medians_c 

1647 caps = self.color or self._caps_c 

1648 

1649 from matplotlib.artist import setp 

1650 setp(bp['boxes'], color=boxes, alpha=1) 

1651 setp(bp['whiskers'], color=whiskers, alpha=1) 

1652 setp(bp['medians'], color=medians, alpha=1) 

1653 setp(bp['caps'], color=caps, alpha=1) 

1654 

1655 def _make_plot(self): 

1656 if self.subplots: 

1657 from pandas.core.series import Series 

1658 self._return_obj = Series() 

1659 

1660 for i, (label, y) in enumerate(self._iter_data()): 

1661 ax = self._get_ax(i) 

1662 kwds = self.kwds.copy() 

1663 

1664 ret, bp = self._plot(ax, y, column_num=i, 

1665 return_type=self.return_type, **kwds) 

1666 self.maybe_color_bp(bp) 

1667 self._return_obj[label] = ret 

1668 

1669 label = [pprint_thing(label)] 

1670 self._set_ticklabels(ax, label) 

1671 else: 

1672 y = self.data.values.T 

1673 ax = self._get_ax(0) 

1674 kwds = self.kwds.copy() 

1675 

1676 ret, bp = self._plot(ax, y, column_num=0, 

1677 return_type=self.return_type, **kwds) 

1678 self.maybe_color_bp(bp) 

1679 self._return_obj = ret 

1680 

1681 labels = [l for l, _ in self._iter_data()] 

1682 labels = [pprint_thing(l) for l in labels] 

1683 if not self.use_index: 

1684 labels = [pprint_thing(key) for key in range(len(labels))] 

1685 self._set_ticklabels(ax, labels) 

1686 

1687 def _set_ticklabels(self, ax, labels): 

1688 if self.orientation == 'vertical': 

1689 ax.set_xticklabels(labels) 

1690 else: 

1691 ax.set_yticklabels(labels) 

1692 

1693 def _make_legend(self): 

1694 pass 

1695 

1696 def _post_plot_logic(self, ax, data): 

1697 pass 

1698 

1699 @property 

1700 def orientation(self): 

1701 if self.kwds.get('vert', True): 

1702 return 'vertical' 

1703 else: 

1704 return 'horizontal' 

1705 

1706 @property 

1707 def result(self): 

1708 if self.return_type is None: 

1709 return super(BoxPlot, self).result 

1710 else: 

1711 return self._return_obj 

1712 

1713 

1714# kinds supported by both dataframe and series 

1715_common_kinds = ['line', 'bar', 'barh', 

1716 'kde', 'density', 'area', 'hist', 'box'] 

1717# kinds supported by dataframe 

1718_dataframe_kinds = ['scatter', 'hexbin'] 

1719# kinds supported only by series or dataframe single column 

1720_series_kinds = ['pie'] 

1721_all_kinds = _common_kinds + _dataframe_kinds + _series_kinds 

1722 

1723_klasses = [LinePlot, BarPlot, BarhPlot, KdePlot, HistPlot, BoxPlot, 

1724 ScatterPlot, HexBinPlot, AreaPlot, PiePlot] 

1725 

1726_plot_klass = {klass._kind: klass for klass in _klasses} 

1727 

1728 

1729def _plot(data, x=None, y=None, subplots=False, 

1730 ax=None, kind='line', **kwds): 

1731 kind = _get_standard_kind(kind.lower().strip()) 

1732 if kind in _all_kinds: 

1733 klass = _plot_klass[kind] 

1734 else: 

1735 raise ValueError("%r is not a valid plot kind" % kind) 

1736 

1737 if kind in _dataframe_kinds: 

1738 if isinstance(data, ABCDataFrame): 

1739 plot_obj = klass(data, x=x, y=y, subplots=subplots, ax=ax, 

1740 kind=kind, **kwds) 

1741 else: 

1742 raise ValueError("plot kind %r can only be used for data frames" 

1743 % kind) 

1744 

1745 elif kind in _series_kinds: 

1746 if isinstance(data, ABCDataFrame): 

1747 if y is None and subplots is False: 

1748 msg = "{0} requires either y column or 'subplots=True'" 

1749 raise ValueError(msg.format(kind)) 

1750 elif y is not None: 

1751 if is_integer(y) and not data.columns.holds_integer(): 

1752 y = data.columns[y] 

1753 # converted to series actually. copy to not modify 

1754 data = data[y].copy() 

1755 data.index.name = y 

1756 plot_obj = klass(data, subplots=subplots, ax=ax, kind=kind, **kwds) 

1757 else: 

1758 if isinstance(data, ABCDataFrame): 

1759 data_cols = data.columns 

1760 if x is not None: 

1761 if is_integer(x) and not data.columns.holds_integer(): 

1762 x = data_cols[x] 

1763 elif not isinstance(data[x], ABCSeries): 

1764 raise ValueError("x must be a label or position") 

1765 data = data.set_index(x) 

1766 

1767 if y is not None: 

1768 # check if we have y as int or list of ints 

1769 int_ylist = is_list_like(y) and all(is_integer(c) for c in y) 

1770 int_y_arg = is_integer(y) or int_ylist 

1771 if int_y_arg and not data.columns.holds_integer(): 

1772 y = data_cols[y] 

1773 

1774 label_kw = kwds['label'] if 'label' in kwds else False 

1775 for kw in ['xerr', 'yerr']: 

1776 if (kw in kwds) and \ 

1777 (isinstance(kwds[kw], string_types) or 

1778 is_integer(kwds[kw])): 

1779 try: 

1780 kwds[kw] = data[kwds[kw]] 

1781 except (IndexError, KeyError, TypeError): 

1782 pass 

1783 

1784 # don't overwrite 

1785 data = data[y].copy() 

1786 

1787 if isinstance(data, ABCSeries): 

1788 label_name = label_kw or y 

1789 data.name = label_name 

1790 else: 

1791 match = is_list_like(label_kw) and len(label_kw) == len(y) 

1792 if label_kw and not match: 

1793 raise ValueError( 

1794 "label should be list-like and same length as y" 

1795 ) 

1796 label_name = label_kw or data.columns 

1797 data.columns = label_name 

1798 

1799 plot_obj = klass(data, subplots=subplots, ax=ax, kind=kind, **kwds) 

1800 

1801 plot_obj.generate() 

1802 plot_obj.draw() 

1803 return plot_obj.result 

1804

1843 column, the values of that column are used to color each point. 

1844 - If `kind` = 'hexbin', you can control the size of the bins with the 

1845 `gridsize` argument. By default, a histogram of the counts around each 

1846 `(x, y)` point is computed. You can specify alternative aggregations 

1847 by passing values to the `C` and `reduce_C_function` arguments. 

1848 `C` specifies the value at each `(x, y)` point and `reduce_C_function` 

1849 is a function of one argument that reduces all the values in a bin to

2001_shared_docs['boxplot'] = """ 

2002 Make a box plot from DataFrame columns. 

2003 

2004 Make a box-and-whisker plot from DataFrame columns, optionally grouped 

2005 by some other columns. A box plot is a method for graphically depicting 

2006 groups of numerical data through their quartiles. 

2007 The box extends from the Q1 to Q3 quartile values of the data, 

2008 with a line at the median (Q2). The whiskers extend from the edges 

2009 of box to show the range of the data. The position of the whiskers 

2010 is set by default to `1.5 * IQR (IQR = Q3 - Q1)` from the edges of the box. 

2011 Outlier points are those past the end of the whiskers. 

2012 

2013 For further details see 

2014 Wikipedia's entry for `boxplot <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Box_plot>`_. 

2015 

2016 Parameters 

2017 ---------- 

2018 column : str or list of str, optional 

2019 Column name or list of names, or vector. 

2020 Can be any valid input to :meth:`pandas.DataFrame.groupby`. 

2021 by : str or array-like, optional 

2022 Column in the DataFrame to :meth:`pandas.DataFrame.groupby`. 

2023 One box-plot will be done per value of columns in `by`. 

2024 ax : object of class matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional 

2025 The matplotlib axes to be used by boxplot. 

2026 fontsize : float or str 

2027 Tick label font size in points or as a string (e.g., `large`). 

2028 rot : int or float, default 0 

2029 The rotation angle of labels (in degrees) 

2030 with respect to the screen coordinate system. 

2031 grid : boolean, default True 

2032 Setting this to True will show the grid. 

2033 figsize : A tuple (width, height) in inches 

2034 The size of the figure to create in matplotlib. 

2035 layout : tuple (rows, columns), optional 

2036 For example, (3, 5) will display the subplots 

2037 using 3 columns and 5 rows, starting from the top-left. 

2038 return_type : {'axes', 'dict', 'both'} or None, default 'axes' 

2039 The kind of object to return. The default is ``axes``. 

2040 

2041 * 'axes' returns the matplotlib axes the boxplot is drawn on. 

2042 * 'dict' returns a dictionary whose values are the matplotlib 

2043 Lines of the boxplot. 

2044 * 'both' returns a namedtuple with the axes and dict. 

2045 * when grouping with ``by``, a Series mapping columns to 

2046 ``return_type`` is returned. 

2047 

2048 If ``return_type`` is `None`, a NumPy array 

2049 of axes with the same shape as ``layout`` is returned. 

2050 **kwds 

2051 All other plotting keyword arguments to be passed to 

2052 :func:`matplotlib.pyplot.boxplot`. 

2053 

2054 Returns 

2055 ------- 

2056 result : 

2057 

2058 The return type depends on the `return_type` parameter: 

2059 

2060 * 'axes' : object of class matplotlib.axes.Axes 

2061 * 'dict' : dict of matplotlib.lines.Line2D objects 

2062 * 'both' : a namedtuple with structure (ax, lines) 

2063 

2064 For data grouped with ``by``: 

2065 

2066 * :class:`~pandas.Series` 

2067 * :class:`~numpy.array` (for ``return_type = None``) 

2068 

2069 See Also 

2070 -------- 

2071 Series.plot.hist: Make a histogram. 

2072 matplotlib.pyplot.boxplot : Matplotlib equivalent plot. 

2073 

2074 Notes 

2075 ----- 

2076 Use ``return_type='dict'`` when you want to tweak the appearance 

2077 of the lines after plotting. In this case a dict containing the Lines 

2078 making up the boxes, caps, fliers, medians, and whiskers is returned. 

2079 

2080 Examples 

2081 -------- 

2082 

2083 Boxplots can be created for every column in the dataframe 

2084 by ``df.boxplot()`` or indicating the columns to be used: 

2085 

2086 .. plot:: 

2087 :context: close-figs 

2088 

2089 >>> np.random.seed(1234) 

2090 >>> df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(10,4), 

2091 ... columns=['Col1', 'Col2', 'Col3', 'Col4']) 

2092 >>> boxplot = df.boxplot(column=['Col1', 'Col2', 'Col3']) 

2093 

2094 Boxplots of variables distributions grouped by the values of a third 

2095 variable can be created using the option ``by``. For instance: 

2096 

2097 .. plot:: 

2098 :context: close-figs 

2099 

2100 >>> df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(10, 2), 

2101 ... columns=['Col1', 'Col2']) 

2102 >>> df['X'] = pd.Series(['A', 'A', 'A', 'A', 'A', 

2103 ... 'B', 'B', 'B', 'B', 'B']) 

2104 >>> boxplot = df.boxplot(by='X') 

2105 

2106 A list of strings (i.e. ``['X', 'Y']``) can be passed to boxplot 

2107 in order to group the data by combination of the variables in the x-axis: 

2108 

2109 .. plot:: 

2110 :context: close-figs 

2111 

2112 >>> df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(10,3), 

2113 ... columns=['Col1', 'Col2', 'Col3']) 

2114 >>> df['X'] = pd.Series(['A', 'A', 'A', 'A', 'A', 

2115 ... 'B', 'B', 'B', 'B', 'B']) 

2116 >>> df['Y'] = pd.Series(['A', 'B', 'A', 'B', 'A', 

2117 ... 'B', 'A', 'B', 'A', 'B']) 

2118 >>> boxplot = df.boxplot(column=['Col1', 'Col2'], by=['X', 'Y']) 

2119 

2120 The layout of boxplot can be adjusted giving a tuple to ``layout``: 

2121 

2122 .. plot:: 

2123 :context: close-figs 

2124 

2125 >>> boxplot = df.boxplot(column=['Col1', 'Col2'], by='X', 

2126 ... layout=(2, 1)) 

2127 

2128 Additional formatting can be done to the boxplot, like suppressing the grid 

2129 (``grid=False``), rotating the labels in the x-axis (i.e. ``rot=45``) 

2130 or changing the fontsize (i.e. ``fontsize=15``): 

2131 

2132 .. plot:: 

2133 :context: close-figs 

2134 

2135 >>> boxplot = df.boxplot(grid=False, rot=45, fontsize=15) 

2136 

2137 The parameter ``return_type`` can be used to select the type of element 

2138 returned by `boxplot`. When ``return_type='axes'`` is selected, 

2139 the matplotlib axes on which the boxplot is drawn are returned: 

2140 

2141 >>> boxplot = df.boxplot(column=['Col1','Col2'], return_type='axes') 

2142 >>> type(boxplot) 

2143 <class 'matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot'> 

2144 

2145 When grouping with ``by``, a Series mapping columns to ``return_type`` 

2146 is returned: 

2147 

2148 >>> boxplot = df.boxplot(column=['Col1', 'Col2'], by='X', 

2149 ... return_type='axes') 

2150 >>> type(boxplot) 

2151 <class 'pandas.core.series.Series'> 

2152 

2153 If ``return_type`` is `None`, a NumPy array of axes with the same shape 

2154 as ``layout`` is returned: 

2155 

2156 >>> boxplot = df.boxplot(column=['Col1', 'Col2'], by='X', 

2157 ... return_type=None) 

2158 >>> type(boxplot) 

2159 <class 'numpy.ndarray'> 

2160 """ 

2161 

2162 

2163@Appender(_shared_docs['boxplot'] % _shared_doc_kwargs) 

2164def boxplot(data, column=None, by=None, ax=None, fontsize=None, 

2165 rot=0, grid=True, figsize=None, layout=None, return_type=None, 

2166 **kwds): 

2167 

2168 # validate return_type: 

2169 if return_type not in BoxPlot._valid_return_types: 

2170 raise ValueError("return_type must be {'axes', 'dict', 'both'}") 

2171 

2172 if isinstance(data, ABCSeries): 

2173 data = data.to_frame('x') 

2174 column = 'x' 

2175 

2176 def _get_colors(): 

2177 # num_colors=3 is required as method maybe_color_bp takes the colors 

2178 # in positions 0 and 2. 

2179 return _get_standard_colors(color=kwds.get('color'), num_colors=3) 

2180 

2181 def maybe_color_bp(bp): 

2182 if 'color' not in kwds: 

2183 from matplotlib.artist import setp 

2184 setp(bp['boxes'], color=colors[0], alpha=1) 

2185 setp(bp['whiskers'], color=colors[0], alpha=1) 

2186 setp(bp['medians'], color=colors[2], alpha=1) 

2187 

2188 def plot_group(keys, values, ax): 

2189 keys = [pprint_thing(x) for x in keys] 

2190 values = [np.asarray(remove_na_arraylike(v)) for v in values] 

2191 bp = ax.boxplot(values, **kwds) 

2192 if fontsize is not None: 

2193 ax.tick_params(axis='both', labelsize=fontsize) 

2194 if kwds.get('vert', 1): 

2195 ax.set_xticklabels(keys, rotation=rot) 

2196 else: 

2197 ax.set_yticklabels(keys, rotation=rot) 

2198 maybe_color_bp(bp) 

2199 

2200 # Return axes in multiplot case, maybe revisit later # 985 

2201 if return_type == 'dict': 

2202 return bp 

2203 elif return_type == 'both': 

2204 return BoxPlot.BP(ax=ax, lines=bp) 

2205 else: 

2206 return ax 

2207 

2208 colors = _get_colors() 

2209 if column is None: 

2210 columns = None 

2211 else: 

2212 if isinstance(column, (list, tuple)): 

2213 columns = column 

2214 else: 

2215 columns = [column] 

2216 

2217 if by is not None: 

2218 # Prefer array return type for 2-D plots to match the subplot layout 

2219 # https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/12216#issuecomment-241175580 

2220 result = _grouped_plot_by_column(plot_group, data, columns=columns, 

2221 by=by, grid=grid, figsize=figsize, 

2222 ax=ax, layout=layout, 

2223 return_type=return_type) 

2224 else: 

2225 if return_type is None: 

2226 return_type = 'axes' 

2227 if layout is not None: 

2228 raise ValueError("The 'layout' keyword is not supported when " 

2229 "'by' is None") 

2230 

2231 if ax is None: 

2232 rc = {'figure.figsize': figsize} if figsize is not None else {} 

2233 ax = _gca(rc) 

2234 data = data._get_numeric_data() 

2235 if columns is None: 

2236 columns = data.columns 

2237 else: 

2238 data = data[columns] 

2239 

2240 result = plot_group(columns, data.values.T, ax) 

2241 ax.grid(grid) 

2242 

2243 return result

2259def scatter_plot(data, x, y, by=None, ax=None, figsize=None, grid=False, 

2260 **kwargs): 

2261 """ 

2262 Make a scatter plot from two DataFrame columns 

2263 

2264 Parameters 

2265 ---------- 

2266 data : DataFrame 

2267 x : Column name for the x-axis values 

2268 y : Column name for the y-axis values 

2269 ax : Matplotlib axis object 

2270 figsize : A tuple (width, height) in inches 

2271 grid : Setting this to True will show the grid 

2272 kwargs : other plotting keyword arguments 

2273 To be passed to scatter function 

2274 

2275 Returns 

2276 ------- 

2277 fig : matplotlib.Figure 

2278 """ 

2279 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 

2280 

2281 kwargs.setdefault('edgecolors', 'none') 

2282 

2283 def plot_group(group, ax): 

2284 xvals = group[x].values 

2285 yvals = group[y].values 

2286 ax.scatter(xvals, yvals, **kwargs) 

2287 ax.grid(grid) 

2288 

2289 if by is not None: 

2290 fig = _grouped_plot(plot_group, data, by=by, figsize=figsize, ax=ax) 

2291 else:

2295 else:

2297 plot_group(data, ax) 

2298 ax.set_ylabel(pprint_thing(y)) 

2299 ax.set_xlabel(pprint_thing(x)) 

2300 

2301 ax.grid(grid) 

2302 

2303 return fig

2306def hist_frame(data, column=None, by=None, grid=True, xlabelsize=None, 

2307 xrot=None, ylabelsize=None, yrot=None, ax=None, sharex=False, 

2308 sharey=False, figsize=None, layout=None, bins=10, **kwds): 

2309 """ 

2310 Make a histogram of the DataFrame's. 

2311 

2312 A `histogram`_ is a representation of the distribution of data. 

2313 This function calls :meth:`matplotlib.pyplot.hist`, on each series in 

2314 the DataFrame, resulting in one histogram per column. 

2315 

2316 .. _histogram: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Histogram 

2317 

2318 Parameters 

2319 ---------- 

2320 data : DataFrame 

2321 The pandas object holding the data. 

2322 column : string or sequence 

2323 If passed, will be used to limit data to a subset of columns. 

2324 by : object, optional 

2325 If passed, then used to form histograms for separate groups. 

2326 grid : boolean, default True 

2327 Whether to show axis grid lines. 

2328 xlabelsize : int, default None 

2329 If specified changes the x-axis label size. 

2330 xrot : float, default None 

2331 Rotation of x axis labels. For example, a value of 90 displays the 

2332 x labels rotated 90 degrees clockwise. 

2333 ylabelsize : int, default None 

2334 If specified changes the y-axis label size. 

2335 yrot : float, default None 

2336 Rotation of y axis labels. For example, a value of 90 displays the 

2337 y labels rotated 90 degrees clockwise. 

2338 ax : Matplotlib axes object, default None 

2339 The axes to plot the histogram on. 

2340 sharex : boolean, default True if ax is None else False 

2341 In case subplots=True, share x axis and set some x axis labels to 

2342 invisible; defaults to True if ax is None otherwise False if an ax 

2343 is passed in. 

2344 Note that passing in both an ax and sharex=True will alter all x axis 

2345 labels for all subplots in a figure. 

2346 sharey : boolean, default False 

2347 In case subplots=True, share y axis and set some y axis labels to 

2348 invisible. 

2349 figsize : tuple 

2350 The size in inches of the figure to create. Uses the value in 

2351 `matplotlib.rcParams` by default. 

2352 layout : tuple, optional 

2353 Tuple of (rows, columns) for the layout of the histograms. 

2354 bins : integer or sequence, default 10 

2355 Number of histogram bins to be used. If an integer is given, bins + 1 

2356 bin edges are calculated and returned. If bins is a sequence, gives 

2357 bin edges, including left edge of first bin and right edge of last 

2358 bin. In this case, bins is returned unmodified. 

2359 **kwds 

2360 All other plotting keyword arguments to be passed to 

2361 :meth:`matplotlib.pyplot.hist`. 

2362 

2363 Returns 

2364 ------- 

2365 axes : matplotlib.AxesSubplot or numpy.ndarray of them 

2366 

2367 See Also 

2368 -------- 

2369 matplotlib.pyplot.hist : Plot a histogram using matplotlib. 

2370 

2371 Examples 

2372 -------- 

2373 

2374 .. plot:: 

2375 :context: close-figs 

2376 

2377 This example draws a histogram based on the length and width of 

2378 some animals, displayed in three bins 

2379 

2380 >>> df = pd.DataFrame({ 

2381 ... 'length': [1.5, 0.5, 1.2, 0.9, 3], 

2382 ... 'width': [0.7, 0.2, 0.15, 0.2, 1.1] 

2383 ... }, index= ['pig', 'rabbit', 'duck', 'chicken', 'horse']) 

2384 >>> hist = df.hist(bins=3) 

2385 """ 

2386 _raise_if_no_mpl() 

2387 _converter._WARN = False 

2388 if by is not None: 

2389 axes = grouped_hist(data, column=column, by=by, ax=ax, grid=grid, 

2390 figsize=figsize, sharex=sharex, sharey=sharey, 

2391 layout=layout, bins=bins, xlabelsize=xlabelsize, 

2392 xrot=xrot, ylabelsize=ylabelsize, 

2393 yrot=yrot, **kwds) 

2394 return axes 

2395 

2396 if column is not None: 

2397 if not isinstance(column, (list, np.ndarray, ABCIndexClass)): 

2398 column = [column] 

2399 data = data[column] 

2400 data = data._get_numeric_data() 

2401 naxes = len(data.columns) 

2402 

2403 fig, axes = _subplots(naxes=naxes, ax=ax, squeeze=False, 

2404 sharex=sharex, sharey=sharey, figsize=figsize, 

2405 layout=layout) 

2406 _axes = _flatten(axes) 

2407 

2408 for i, col in enumerate(com.try_sort(data.columns)): 

2409 ax = _axes[i] 

2410 ax.hist(data[col].dropna().values, bins=bins, **kwds) 

2411 ax.set_title(col) 

2412 ax.grid(grid) 

2413 

2414 _set_ticks_props(axes, xlabelsize=xlabelsize, xrot=xrot, 

2415 ylabelsize=ylabelsize, yrot=yrot) 

2416 fig.subplots_adjust(wspace=0.3, hspace=0.3) 

2417 

2418 return axes

2421def hist_series(self, by=None, ax=None, grid=True, xlabelsize=None, 

2422 xrot=None, ylabelsize=None, yrot=None, figsize=None, 

2423 bins=10, **kwds): 

2424 """ 

2425 Draw histogram of the input series using matplotlib. 

2426 

2427 Parameters 

2428 ---------- 

2429 by : object, optional 

2430 If passed, then used to form histograms for separate groups 

2431 ax : matplotlib axis object 

2432 If not passed, uses gca() 

2433 grid : boolean, default True 

2434 Whether to show axis grid lines 

2435 xlabelsize : int, default None 

2436 If specified changes the x-axis label size 

2437 xrot : float, default None 

2438 rotation of x axis labels 

2439 ylabelsize : int, default None 

2440 If specified changes the y-axis label size 

2441 yrot : float, default None 

2442 rotation of y axis labels 

2443 figsize : tuple, default None 

2444 figure size in inches by default 

2445 bins : integer or sequence, default 10 

2446 Number of histogram bins to be used. If an integer is given, bins + 1 

2447 bin edges are calculated and returned. If bins is a sequence, gives 

2448 bin edges, including left edge of first bin and right edge of last 

2449 bin. In this case, bins is returned unmodified. 

2450 bins : integer, default 10 

2451 Number of histogram bins to be used 

2452 `**kwds` : keywords 

2453 To be passed to the actual plotting function 

2454 

2455 See Also 

2456 -------- 

2457 matplotlib.axes.Axes.hist : Plot a histogram using matplotlib. 

2458 """ 

2459 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 

2460 

2461 if by is None: 

2462 if kwds.get('layout', None) is not None: 

2463 raise ValueError("The 'layout' keyword is not supported when " 

2464 "'by' is None") 

2465 # hack until the plotting interface is a bit more unified 

2466 fig = kwds.pop('figure', plt.gcf() if plt.get_fignums() else 

2467 plt.figure(figsize=figsize)) 

2468 if (figsize is not None and tuple(figsize) != 

2469 tuple(fig.get_size_inches())): 

2470 fig.set_size_inches(*figsize, forward=True) 

2471 if ax is None: 

2472 ax = fig.gca() 

2473 elif ax.get_figure() != fig: 

2474 raise AssertionError('passed axis not bound to passed figure') 

2475 values = self.dropna().values 

2476 

2477 ax.hist(values, bins=bins, **kwds) 

2478 ax.grid(grid) 

2479 axes = np.array([ax]) 

2480 

2481 _set_ticks_props(axes, xlabelsize=xlabelsize, xrot=xrot, 

2482 ylabelsize=ylabelsize, yrot=yrot) 

2483 

2484 else: 

2485 if 'figure' in kwds: 

2486 raise ValueError("Cannot pass 'figure' when using the " 

2487 "'by' argument, since a new 'Figure' instance " 

2488 "will be created") 

2489 axes = grouped_hist(self, by=by, ax=ax, grid=grid, figsize=figsize, 

2490 bins=bins, xlabelsize=xlabelsize, xrot=xrot, 

2491 ylabelsize=ylabelsize, yrot=yrot, **kwds) 

2492 

2493 if hasattr(axes, 'ndim'): 

2494 if axes.ndim == 1 and len(axes) == 1: 

2495 return axes[0] 

2496 return axes 

2497 

2498 

2499def grouped_hist(data, column=None, by=None, ax=None, bins=50, figsize=None, 

2500 layout=None, sharex=False, sharey=False, rot=90, grid=True, 

2501 xlabelsize=None, xrot=None, ylabelsize=None, yrot=None, 

2502 **kwargs): 

2503 """ 

2504 Grouped histogram 

2505 

2506 Parameters 

2507 ---------- 

2508 data : Series/DataFrame 

2509 column : object, optional 

2510 by : object, optional 

2511 ax : axes, optional 

2512 bins : int, default 50 

2513 figsize : tuple, optional 

2514 layout : optional 

2515 sharex : boolean, default False 

2516 sharey : boolean, default False 

2517 rot : int, default 90 

2518 grid : bool, default True 

2519 kwargs : dict, keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.Axes.hist 

2520 

2521 Returns 

2522 ------- 

2523 axes : collection of Matplotlib Axes 

2524 """ 

2525 _raise_if_no_mpl() 

2526 _converter._WARN = False 

2527 

2528 def plot_group(group, ax): 

2529 ax.hist(group.dropna().values, bins=bins, **kwargs) 

2530 

2531 xrot = xrot or rot 

2532 

2533 fig, axes = _grouped_plot(plot_group, data, column=column, 

2534 by=by, sharex=sharex, sharey=sharey, ax=ax, 

2535 figsize=figsize, layout=layout, rot=rot) 

2536 

2537 _set_ticks_props(axes, xlabelsize=xlabelsize, xrot=xrot, 

2538 ylabelsize=ylabelsize, yrot=yrot) 

2539 

2540 fig.subplots_adjust(bottom=0.15, top=0.9, left=0.1, right=0.9, 

2541 hspace=0.5, wspace=0.3) 

2542 return axes 

2543 

2544 

2545def boxplot_frame_groupby(grouped, subplots=True, column=None, fontsize=None, 

2546 rot=0, grid=True, ax=None, figsize=None, 

2547 layout=None, sharex=False, sharey=True, **kwds): 

2548 """ 

2549 Make box plots from DataFrameGroupBy data. 

2550 

2551 Parameters 

2552 ---------- 

2553 grouped : Grouped DataFrame 

2554 subplots : 

2555 * ``False`` - no subplots will be used 

2556 * ``True`` - create a subplot for each group 

2557 column : column name or list of names, or vector 

2558 Can be any valid input to groupby 

2559 fontsize : int or string 

2560 rot : label rotation angle 

2561 grid : Setting this to True will show the grid 

2562 ax : Matplotlib axis object, default None 

2563 figsize : A tuple (width, height) in inches 

2564 layout : tuple (optional) 

2565 (rows, columns) for the layout of the plot 

2566 sharex : bool, default False 

2567 Whether x-axes will be shared among subplots 

2568 

2569 .. versionadded:: 0.23.1 

2570 sharey : bool, default True 

2571 Whether y-axes will be shared among subplots 

2572 

2573 .. versionadded:: 0.23.1 

2574 `**kwds` : Keyword Arguments 

2575 All other plotting keyword arguments to be passed to 

2576 matplotlib's boxplot function 

2577 

2578 Returns 

2579 ------- 

2580 dict of key/value = group key/DataFrame.boxplot return value 

2581 or DataFrame.boxplot return value in case subplots=figures=False 

2582 

2583 Examples 

2584 -------- 

2585 >>> import itertools 

2586 >>> tuples = [t for t in itertools.product(range(1000), range(4))] 

2587 >>> index = pd.MultiIndex.from_tuples(tuples, names=['lvl0', 'lvl1']) 

2588 >>> data = np.random.randn(len(index),4) 

2589 >>> df = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=list('ABCD'), index=index) 

2590 >>> 

2591 >>> grouped = df.groupby(level='lvl1') 

2592 >>> boxplot_frame_groupby(grouped) 

2593 >>> 

2594 >>> grouped = df.unstack(level='lvl1').groupby(level=0, axis=1) 

2595 >>> boxplot_frame_groupby(grouped, subplots=False) 

2596 """ 

2597 _raise_if_no_mpl() 

2598 _converter._WARN = False 

2599 if subplots is True: 

2600 naxes = len(grouped) 

2601 fig, axes = _subplots(naxes=naxes, squeeze=False, 

2602 ax=ax, sharex=sharex, sharey=sharey, 

2603 figsize=figsize, layout=layout) 

2604 axes = _flatten(axes) 

2605 

2606 from pandas.core.series import Series 

2607 ret = Series() 

2608 for (key, group), ax in zip(grouped, axes): 

2609 d = group.boxplot(ax=ax, column=column, fontsize=fontsize, 

2610 rot=rot, grid=grid, **kwds) 

2611 ax.set_title(pprint_thing(key)) 

2612 ret.loc[key] = d 

2613 fig.subplots_adjust(bottom=0.15, top=0.9, left=0.1, 

2614 right=0.9, wspace=0.2) 

2615 else: 

2616 from pandas.core.reshape.concat import concat 

2617 keys, frames = zip(*grouped) 

2618 if grouped.axis == 0: 

2619 df = concat(frames, keys=keys, axis=1) 

2620 else: 

2621 if len(frames) > 1: 

2622 df = frames[0].join(frames[1::]) 

2623 else: 

2624 df = frames[0] 

2625 ret = df.boxplot(column=column, fontsize=fontsize, rot=rot, 

2626 grid=grid, ax=ax, figsize=figsize, 

2627 layout=layout, **kwds) 

2628 return ret 

2629 

2630 

2631def _grouped_plot(plotf, data, column=None, by=None, numeric_only=True, 

2632 figsize=None, sharex=True, sharey=True, layout=None, 

2633 rot=0, ax=None, **kwargs): 

2634 

2635 if figsize == 'default': 

2636 # allowed to specify mpl default with 'default' 

2637 warnings.warn("figsize='default' is deprecated. Specify figure" 

2638 "size by tuple instead", FutureWarning, stacklevel=4) 

2639 figsize = None 

2640 

2641 grouped = data.groupby(by) 

2642 if column is not None: 

2643 grouped = grouped[column] 

2644 

2645 naxes = len(grouped) 

2646 fig, axes = _subplots(naxes=naxes, figsize=figsize, 

2647 sharex=sharex, sharey=sharey, ax=ax, 

2648 layout=layout) 

2649 

2650 _axes = _flatten(axes) 

2651 

2652 for i, (key, group) in enumerate(grouped): 

2653 ax = _axes[i] 

2654 if numeric_only and isinstance(group, ABCDataFrame): 

2655 group = group._get_numeric_data() 

2656 plotf(group, ax, **kwargs) 

2657 ax.set_title(pprint_thing(key)) 

2658 

2659 return fig, axes 

2660 

2661 

2662def _grouped_plot_by_column(plotf, data, columns=None, by=None, 

2663 numeric_only=True, grid=False, 

2664 figsize=None, ax=None, layout=None, 

2665 return_type=None, **kwargs): 

2666 grouped = data.groupby(by) 

2667 if columns is None: 

2668 if not isinstance(by, (list, tuple)): 

2669 by = [by] 

2670 columns = data._get_numeric_data().columns.difference(by) 

2671 naxes = len(columns) 

2672 fig, axes = _subplots(naxes=naxes, sharex=True, sharey=True, 

2673 figsize=figsize, ax=ax, layout=layout) 

2674 

2675 _axes = _flatten(axes) 

2676 

2677 ax_values = [] 

2678 

2679 for i, col in enumerate(columns): 

2680 ax = _axes[i] 

2681 gp_col = grouped[col] 

2682 keys, values = zip(*gp_col) 

2683 re_plotf = plotf(keys, values, ax, **kwargs) 

2684 ax.set_title(col) 

2685 ax.set_xlabel(pprint_thing(by)) 

2686 ax_values.append(re_plotf) 

2687 ax.grid(grid) 

2688 

2689 from pandas.core.series import Series 

2690 result = Series(ax_values, index=columns) 

2691 

2692 # Return axes in multiplot case, maybe revisit later # 985 

2693 if return_type is None: 

2694 result = axes 

2695 

2696 byline = by[0] if len(by) == 1 else by 

2697 fig.suptitle('Boxplot grouped by {byline}'.format(byline=byline)) 

2698 fig.subplots_adjust(bottom=0.15, top=0.9, left=0.1, right=0.9, wspace=0.2) 

2699 

2700 return result

2725 """

2741 xerr=xerr, label=label, secondary_y=secondary_y, 

2742 **kwds)

2836 @Appender(_kde_docstring % { 

2837 'this-datatype': 'Series', 

2838 'sibling-datatype': 'DataFrame', 

2839 'examples': """ 

2840 Given a Series of points randomly sampled from an unknown 

2841 distribution, estimate its PDF using KDE with automatic 

2842 bandwidth determination and plot the results, evaluating them at 

2843 1000 equally spaced points (default): 

2844 

2845 .. plot::

2850 

2851 A scalar bandwidth can be specified. Using a small bandwidth value can 

2852 lead to over-fitting, while using a large bandwidth value may result 

2853 in under-fitting: 

2854 

2855 .. plot::

2859 

2860 .. plot::

2864

2866 plot of the estimated PDF: 

2867 

2868 .. plot:: 

2869 :context: close-figs 

2870 

2871 >>> ax = s.plot.kde(ind=[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) 

2872 """.strip() 

2873 })
